item.title: Thousands of Migrants Reach Austria as New Groups Set Off
item.description: Nearly 5,000 exhausted migrants arrived in Austria after Hungary helped them travel in safety, but the Hungarian government said it would not provide buses to additional migrants.
item.category: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
item.dc:creator: ALISON SMALE and STEVEN ERLANGER
item.media:description: Migrants walking along the highway near Nickelsdorf, Austria, after crossing over the border from Hungary on Saturday.

item.title: Op-Ed Columnist: A Silver Lining to Brazil’s Troubles
item.description: The economy is in tatters, but the country’s handling of a huge corruption case shows its democracy and judicial institutions are working.
item.dc:creator: JOE NOCERA

item.title: News Analysis: As Vote Looms, Some in Guatemala Foresee More Frustration
item.description: Many Guatemalans who had been involved in demonstrations that helped force a presidential resignation expressed concern that the country’s entrenched political class might again come to power.
item.dc:creator: ELISABETH MALKIN
item.media:description: Alejandro Maldonado attended a ceremony Friday in Guatemala City. He was sworn in as Guatemala’s interim president after Otto Pérez Molina stepped down.

item.title: Russian Moves in Syria Pose Concerns for U.S.
item.description: President Vladimir V. Putin has sent a military advance team to Syria and is taking other steps that the United States fears could lead Russia to expand its military support for President Bashar al-Assad, administration officials said.
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL R. GORDON and ERIC SCHMITT
item.media:description: President Bashar al-Assad of Syria, right, discussed the war in his country with the Russian deputy foreign minister, Mikhail Bogdanov, during a meeting in December 2014 in Damascus, Syria.

item.title: The American Response: Many Obstacles Are Seen to U.S. Taking in Large Number of Syrian Refugees
item.description: Little appetite for intervention from a country still weary from two wars and struggling with its own immigration problems.
item.category: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
item.dc:creator: DAVID M. HERSZENHORN

item.title: Migrants Cross Austria Border From Hungary
item.description: After thousands embarked on a 300-mile march toward Germany on Friday, the government retreated from enforcing European immigration restrictions.
item.category: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
item.dc:creator: RICK LYMAN, ANEMONA HARTOCOLLIS and ALISON SMALE
item.media:description: Migrants celebrated on a bus bound for Austria and Germany near the Keleti train station in Budapest early Saturday.

item.title: Obama and Saudi King Sidestep Dispute Over Iran Nuclear Deal
item.description: At the beginning of their meetings at the White House, the two leaders stressed a long history of cooperation and friendship between their nations.
item.dc:creator: PETER BAKER

item.title: Historical Echoes: Treatment of Migrants Evokes Memories of Europe’s Darkest Hour
item.description: Jewish and human rights figures warn of historical amnesia as migrants are tricked into going to camps, marked with identification numbers and denounced as dangerous outsiders with a foreign religion.
item.category: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
item.dc:creator: RICK LYMAN
item.media:description: Police officers on Friday guarded a so-called reception center for migrants in Roszke, Hungary. Some migrants were tricked into boarding trains for such camps.

item.title: Key Senate Democrat Announces Opposition to Iran Nuclear Deal
item.description: Benjamin L. Cardin, the senior Democrat on the Foreign Relations Committee, said he would push for legislation to controls on how the accord is carried out.
item.dc:creator: CARL HULSE and DAVID M. HERSZENHORN

item.title: World Briefing: Syria: More Antiquities Destroyed by ISIS in Ancient City of Palmyra
item.description: The Islamic State has blown up three ancient funeral towers in the city of Palmyra, Syria’s antiquities chief said.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: REUTERS

item.title: World Briefing: Syria: Food Support is Reduced
item.description: The World Food Program has been forced to cut back by a third its food voucher program for Syrian refugees living in neighboring countries.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: World Briefing: Spain: Prime Minister Supports E.U. Reforms Sought by Britain
item.description: Prime Minister Mariano Rajoy of Spain gave support Friday to a campaign by Prime Minister David Cameron of Britain to press for structural changes in the European Union.
item.dc:creator: REUTERS

item.title: World Briefing: Ukraine: Two Ultranationalists Are Charged Over Clashes in Kiev
item.description: Two senior members of an ultranationalist party were charged by the authorities on Friday for their involvement in violent clashes this week in Kiev.
item.dc:creator: AGENCE FRANCE-PRESSE

item.title: Islamist Rebels and the Police Clash in Tajikistan, Killing 17
item.description: The government said a deputy defense minister, Maj. Gen. Abdukhalim Nazarzoda, had sided with the Islamist rebels and fled after the clashes.
item.dc:creator: ANDREW E. KRAMER
item.media:description: The police secured an area of Dushanbe, the capital of Tajikistan, where armed groups led a series of attacks on Friday.

item.title: Houthi Rebels Kill 45 U.A.E. Soldiers in Yemen Fighting
item.description: The death total, the largest in a single day for the military of the United Arab Emirates, was a major setback for the coalition of Arab forces trying to vanquish the rebels.
item.dc:creator: KAREEM FAHIM

item.title: U.N. Official Urges Stronger Action by Peacekeepers in Central African Republic
item.description: Zeid Ra’ad al-Hussein, the United Nations human rights chief, said improvements in the country, riven by ethnic and sexual violence in 2013, were “too gradual.”
item.dc:creator: NICK CUMMING-BRUCE

item.title: A Day After 71 Migrants Died, 81 Escaped the Back of a Truck in Austria
item.description: A police official said migrants who pried open a truck door and escaped were apparently taken to Western Europe by the same smugglers as the migrants who died.
item.category: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
item.dc:creator: ALISON SMALE
item.media:description: Hans Peter Doskozil, the police chief in Burgenland, Austria's easternmost province. Mr. Doskozil said the same smuggling ring involved in the death of 71 migrants in a truck might have been responsible for abandoning scores of other migrants.

item.title: Chinese Navy Ships Entered U.S. Waters Legally, Pentagon Says
item.description: At one point, the ships came within 12 nautical miles of the United States, which put them inside American territorial waters, a spokesman said.
item.dc:creator: HELENE COOPER

item.title: Opinion: Israeli Terrorists, Born in the U.S.A.
item.description: Many of the West Bank’s most violent extremists have roots in the U.S.
item.dc:creator: SARA YAEL HIRSCHHORN
item.media:description: A photograph of Ali Dawabsheh, the Palestinian toddler killed in an arson attack on his home in the West Bank village of Duma in July.

item.title: Greenpeace India Says It Will Continue Environmental Campaign
item.description: The government revoked the group’s ability to receive foreign donations as part of its crackdown on nongovernmental organizations.
item.dc:creator: NIDA NAJAR
